title: What with these HUGE cookie file sizes?
content:
I took a look today and I had 237 MB in cookies! This was after clearing the cache of all files. I've only had this (new) machine a couple months.

Short version: Sites have "cookies" from 200kb to as much as 34MB! For many of the sites over 3MB I have no account and have visited them only briefly.

To be clear, I don't care about the space being used. It's trivial. But what the heck is FFox storing and calling it "cookies"? Last I checked, a site was still limited to 4K size cookies and perhaps 50 per domain. So how are we getting to MB+ sized "cookies" per site? Again, the cache was cleared, so what's left aside from trivial cookie files of <4KB?

Desktop; Windows 11; Firefox 139.0.4 64 bit
creator: MozzieBob

title: captcha on Zazzle.com
content: Hello, I am trying to login to my account on www.zazzle.com and use their site. Sometimes it will let me through and I can be on the site for about 20 minutes before a captcha comes up that says press and hold this button so we know you are not a bot. Well the button never works, it always errs out and gives me the message to please try again, and then locks me out of their site. I have tried clearing my cache and cookies, updating my browser, resetting the router, I don't have any VPN's, I have tried working in a private window, adding the website to the privacy exceptions, block pop up windows is unchecked, I am out of ideas, what do I do??
creator: sedye17

title: Exporting my pocket list
content:
Hi,

I have sent an email to support but didn't receive an answer yet, so I hope someone here might be able to help me.

So I've been trying to export my Pocket list, but didn't receive any my email.

After going over few of the support articles. I've noticed that my email didn't show up in the settings of Pocket. I have updated the email address, but I am not receiving the confirmation email.

I've tried 3 different email address.

Any idea what can I do? Thanks!
creator: Dati42

title: How to disable automatic translations
content: I'm having some trouble with automatic translations on firefox. I don't know if It's exclusive of firefox, but some websites, mostly wikis, open a "translate" field that automatically creates a new website, wich causes the images and some other stuff on the website to break. I tried disabling the translation on about:config off, as show in some other questions, but it did not work. This is being really annoying because it keeps breaking websites unless i get to the original link.
creator: valenteeduardo39
